title: NFL Combine performance tracker with guest mode, drill logging, benchmarks, and shareable results

requirements.text: Add a guest mode so the app can be used immediately without requiring Internet Identity login; in guest mode, store Combine entries locally (per-browser) and clearly label the mode as "Guest (local only)" in the UI.

quotes: Can you build app right now without that please üôè

acceptanceCriteria: When the user is not authenticated, the Landing page offers a "Continue as Guest" action.
Guest users can create, view, and edit Combine results and history without logging in.
Guest data persists across page refreshes (localStorage) but is not shared across devices.
The UI clearly distinguishes Guest mode from signed-in mode.

requirements.text: Implement a new Combine module that supports recording all standard NFL Combine drills and measurements in a "latest/official format" data entry flow, including at minimum: 40-yard dash (with split fields if provided), vertical jump, broad jump, bench press reps, 20-yard shuttle, 3-cone drill, and key measurements (height, weight, wingspan/arm length, hand size).

quotes: Can you build app right now without that please üôè

acceptanceCriteria: A signed-in user can create and save a Combine result entry to the backend.
A guest user can create and save the same Combine result entry locally.
The entry form validates numeric fields and units (seconds, inches/cm, lbs/kg) and prevents invalid saves.
Each saved entry includes a timestamp/date and an optional note field.

requirements.text: Add Combine history and progress views that list past entries and provide simple trend charts over time per drill/measurement (e.g., 40 time, vertical, bench reps).

quotes: Can you build app right now without that please üôè

acceptanceCriteria: Users can view a history list of Combine entries sorted newest-first.
Selecting an entry shows a readable detail view of all recorded stats.
Users can view drill-specific trends over time (at least line charts for 40-yard dash, vertical jump, bench reps).
History and trends work for both guest (local) and signed-in (backend) data sources.

requirements.text: Add comparison against official/typical NFL Combine benchmarks by displaying reference values next to each recorded drill (e.g., average/target ranges) and highlighting whether the user is above/near/below the reference.

quotes: Can you build app right now without that please üôè

acceptanceCriteria: Each drill shown in the entry detail view includes a benchmark reference value or range.
The UI indicates comparison state (e.g., Above / Near / Below) using accessible text (not color alone).
Benchmarks are presented as informational context only, with no absolute claims or insulting/judgmental language.

requirements.text: Implement a broadcasting/sharing mode for Combine results: allow a user to generate a shareable "Combine Card" view for a selected entry and copy a share link; for signed-in users, support publishing a specific entry to a public list that is viewable without login.

quotes: Can you build app right now without that please üôè

acceptanceCriteria: A user can open a "Share" action from a Combine entry detail page.
The app renders a clean "Combine Card" view suitable for screenshot/sharing.
For signed-in users, a "Publish" toggle creates/updates a publicly readable representation of that entry in the backend and returns a stable share URL.
Public share pages display only the published entry and do not expose private per-user data.

requirements.text: Refocus the app‚Äôs navigation and landing experience around the NFL Combine tracker (rename title/branding, update primary routes, and add navigation items for Combine: Dashboard, New Entry, History, Share/Published). Keep all user-facing text in English.

quotes: Can you build app right now without that please üôè

acceptanceCriteria: App header/title and Landing page describe an NFL Combine performance tracker rather than a recovery/medications app.
The main navigation includes Combine-focused destinations and the default signed-in route lands on the Combine dashboard.
Existing recovery-related pages are not presented as primary navigation items.
All new user-facing strings are in English.

requirements.text: Extend the Motoko backend actor to persist Combine entries per user and to store/read published (public) Combine entries needed for share links and a simple public feed.

quotes: Can you build app right now without that please üôè

acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes update/query methods to create/list/get Combine entries scoped to the caller principal.
Backend exposes methods to publish/unpublish an entry and to fetch a published entry without requiring the caller to be the owner (public read).
Access control prevents reading/writing another user‚Äôs private Combine entries.
Published entries contain only the fields required for the Combine Card/public view.

requirements.text: If the backend uses stable state that requires upgrade support, update migration logic to initialize any new Combine-related storage while preserving existing stored data.

quotes: Can you build app right now without that please üôè

acceptanceCriteria: Upgrading the canister does not break existing stored state.
New Combine maps/collections are initialized to empty for existing users upon upgrade.
Existing migration behavior remains correct for previously stored fields.

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo.
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui or any path listed in frontend.immutablePaths.
Do not implement true 24/7 background recording or device-wide persistence guarantees; only user-entered logging and normal web storage/back-end persistence are in scope.
No violent/harassing/insulting language in the UI; keep competitive features framed positively and non-judgmentally.
nonGoals: Implementing third-party authentication (only Internet Identity is supported).
Building a real-time global leaderboard of "all men" or any demographic-wide ranking.
Audio/video capture or automatic timing measurement from sensors/camera.
Push notifications or background services that run when the browser/app is closed.

required: Modern athletic app logo with a football/combine stopwatch motif (combine-logo.dim_512x512.png)
Wide hero illustration of an athlete training for combine drills in a clean, modern graphic style (combine-hero.dim_1600x900.png)
